title: Australia floods: Unfounded cloud seeding claims spread online
description: False suggestions that Sydney floods were linked to weather manipulation reach thousands online.

title: Covid: Norfolk man says he is 'fighting every day for life'
description: A man who spent two months in a coma after having Covid says people should "never give up".

title: Police officers 'photographed and manipulated body of suicide victim'
description: Allegations emerge that two police officers manipulated the body and shared photos and video online.

title: Paradise reopened - Bali hopes for tourists to return
description: The Indonesian island wants holidaymakers to come back as it reopens after two years.

title: Chagos Islands FA: The team representing a lost homeland, 6,000 miles away
description: The Chagos Islands football team are trying to keep the story of their ancestors alive, 6,000 miles from their disputed homeland.

title: Boris Johnson: Welsh Secretary Simon Hart quits cabinet
description: Simon Hart was among the cabinet ministers who had earlier urged Boris Johnson to resign.

title: Euro 2022: A night like no other for women's football in England
description: On a night that will be remembered for the occasion rather than England's performance, Euro 2022 gets off to a flying start in front of 68,871 at Old Trafford.

title: England v Austria: How you rated the players from Euro 2022 opener at Old Trafford
description: How did you rate the players as England begin their Euro 2022 campaign with a win over Austria at Old Trafford?

title: Gwynedd: Sheep rescued after 10 days stuck in mine shaft
description: Rescue team members descend on ropes into a mine to haul the trapped sheep back to safety

title: Mary-Sophie Harvey says she was drugged at World Swimming Championships
description: Canadian swimmer Mary-Sophie Harvey says she was drugged during the final night of the World Championships in Budapest last month.

title: Euro 2022: Biggest women's sporting event in European history kicks off
description: A record-breaking 500,000 tickets have been sold for Euro 2022, which kicks off with hosts England on Wednesday.

title: How to watch every Women's Euro 2022 game on the BBC
description: How to watch every Uefa Women's Euro 2022 game on the BBC this July.

title: Euro 2022: Beth Mead's goal gives England winning start against Austria
description: Watch highlights as England beat Austria in the opening match of the European Women's Championship.

title: Ukraine round-up: Evacuation under fire and new oil tensions
description: Civilians flee Ukraine's eastern city of Slovyansk and Kazakh oil is hit by a Russian court ruling.

title: Euro 2022: Beth Mead gives England lead against Austria at Old Trafford
description: England's Beth Mead scores the opening goal against Austria at Old Trafford in the first match of the European Women's Championship.

title: Rafael Nadal beats Taylor Fritz in Wimbledon quarter-finals
description: Rafael Nadal fights through injury to come from behind to beat Taylor Fritz and reach the Wimbledon semi-finals.

title: Circus acrobat injured in human cannonball stunt in Caerphilly
description: Phone footage shows the performer missing a safety net during a "human cannonball" stunt.

title: Boris Johnson met Russian oligarch Lebedev without aides
description: The prime minister admits he met Alexander Lebedev, an ex-KGB agent, without officials present.

title: Alexia Putellas: Spain star on Euro 2022-ending injury - 'I have faith I can get back on track'
description: Spain's Alexia Putellas says "I have faith I can recover, get back on track and finished what I started" as an injury rules her out of Euro 2022.

title: Former cameraman Peter Jouvenal speaks following release
description: Former cameraman Peter Jouvenal was held by the Taliban for six months.

title: Three contested Michael Jackson songs removed from streaming services
description: The songs, which fans have claimed contain 'fake' vocals, have been pulled from Spotify and YouTube.

title: Fourth Thor film is 'funny but silly', critics say
description: Taika Waititi's Thor: Love and Thunder receives broadly positive reviews, with some reservations.

title: Boris Johnson: Embattled PM vows to keep going amid Tory revolt
description: The PM says he has a "colossal" mandate from voters and will stay despite a growing revolt among Tory MPs.

title: The problems start at the top, Javid tells PM
description: Former health secretary Sajid Javid says the government's problems and scandals "start at the top".

title: Whiskas pet food off Tesco shelves after price row
description: Brand owner Mars pauses supply of pet foods to the UK's biggest supermarket chain in price row.

title: Police probed Chris Pincher assault allegations
description: No further action was taken by either the Metropolitan or Staffordshire Police forces.

title: Trans tweets woman discriminated against, tribunal rules
description: Maya Forstater lost her job at a think tank over tweets saying people cannot change their biological sex.

title: British Triathlon becomes first UK sport to create 'open' category for transgender athletes
description: Transgender athletes will be barred from the female category at all events where there are prizes, times or rankings at stake, including at grassroots level.

title: How might Boris Johnson be removed as PM?
description: The PM is clinging on but if his premiership does come to an end, here is how it might happen.

title: Who is Michelle Donelan and what is the new education secretary facing?
description: The new education secretary will have to take on rising costs for schools, and Covid catch-up pressures.

title: Pound slides to two-year low against the dollar
description: Investors flock to the safe haven dollar over concerns about the outlook for UK economic growth.

title: Mason: Johnson facing day of judgement
description: The prime minister is about to face MPs' questions as he sees ministers resign from his government.

title: Zara Aleena died from head and neck injuries, coroner hears
description: Jordan McSweeney, 29, is accused of her murder and remains in custody.

title: Friends creator says show used wrong pronouns for Chandler's trans parent
description: Marta Kauffman says it was a mistake not to use female pronouns for Chandler's transgender parent.

title: Question of Sport: How will you get on in this week's Euros-themed quiz?
description: The Question of Sport team have put together a quiz to test your knowledge of the Women's European Championship.

title: Chicago shooting: Parents of two-year-old boy among victims
description: Irina McCarthy and Kevin McCarthy were shot dead by a gunman, leaving their son Aiden an orphan.

title: We're so short-staffed our hotel has to turn people away
description: Business owners say they face increasing problems due to staffing shortages and soaring inflation.

title: Meet the Lionesses: TikTok, turtlenecks and a world without bananas
description: BBC Sport's Liam Loftus takes a tour of England's media day to ask the Lionesses some of the silliest questions they will face ahead of Euro 2022.

description: The resignation of Rishi Sunak and Sajid Javid from Boris Johnson's government dominates headlines.

title: England keeper ready for 'crazy' Euro 2022 opener
description: Ellie Roebuck says she is "chomping at the bit" to start England's bid for Euro 2022 glory.

title: Mumbai: Heavy rains bring Indian city to a standstill
description: Millions are battling flooding and overflowing sewers as monsoon rains lash India's financial capital.

title: Ukraine war: Market hit as Russians shell frontline city Slovyansk
description: Two people died in Russian strikes on Ukraine's eastern city of Slovyansk, local officials say.

title: Sidhu Moose Wala: The unsettling legacy of the rapper's protest music
description: It has been more than a month since the rapper was shot dead. But he is still making headlines.

title: Trans rescue: A future refuge for those fleeing violence

title: Arabs believe economy is weak under democracy
description: People are losing faith in democracy to deliver economic stability across Middle East and North Africa, according to a major new survey.

title: Studio Electrophonique: The council house that launched top British bands
description: A new film tells the story of how a Sheffield car mechanic's home doubled as Studio Electrophonique.
